Tarletons tragical treatises contaynyng sundrie discourses and prety conceytes, both in prose and verse. Tarlton, Richard, d. 1588, supposed name. aut
[16+] p.
By Henry Bynneman, Imprinted at London : An. 1578.
Although the Dedication is signed "Richard Tarleton", he was probably not the author.--STC. Signatures: *+. Identified as STC 23688a on UMI microfilm. Imperfect: lacks all after *8. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======
Tarletons tragical treatises contaynyng sundrie discourses and prety conceytes, both in prose and verse. Tarlton, Richard, d. 1588, supposed name. aut
[16+] p.
By Henry Bynneman, Imprinted at London : An. 1578.
Although the Dedication is signed "Richard Tarleton", he was probably not the author.--STC. Signatures: *+. Identified as STC 23688a on UMI microfilm. Imperfect: lacks all after *8. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
Henry Bynneman
